revised_title: Proton-Proton Spin-Orbit Interaction and the Repulsive Core
tldr: The authors investigate the proton-proton spin-orbit interaction and its connection to the repulsive core using a truncated potential that only couples positive energy states. They propose an iterative method of solution and apply it to a square repulsive core potential. The phase shifts show splitting, as expected from Thomas term arguments, indicating that the method is effective in explaining the spin-orbit force in the proton-proton interaction.
